title: Imposing Sanctions on Certain Persons With Respect to the Humanitarian and Human Rights Crisis in Ethiopia

enrichment.summary: This executive order imposes sanctions on foreign individuals and entities responsible for fueling the conflict and humanitarian crisis in northern Ethiopia. It blocks their assets, restricts U.S. financial dealings with them, and suspends their entry into the United States to pressure them to stop violence and support peace efforts. The order also aims to ensure humanitarian aid can reach those in need despite the ongoing crisis.
potential_concerns: Sanctions targeting foreign government officials and entities involved in the Ethiopia conflict may escalate regional instability and harm humanitarian access despite intentions to facilitate aid delivery, impacting international organizations and aid recipients.

Travel restrictions and asset freezes on certain individuals could complicate diplomatic negotiations and peace efforts, potentially prolonging the conflict affecting citizens of Ethiopia and Eritrea.

Sanctions may inadvertently restrict financial channels critical for non-blocked civilians and humanitarian groups, disrupting aid flow and worsening conditions for vulnerable international aid recipients.

The broad inclusion of political subdivisions and military forces risks overreach, potentially deterring engagement by legitimate regional actors and complicating conflict resolution efforts in northern Ethiopia.
